page.title: 03EDUCATION
page.content:
THE LOCAL SCHOOL CLOSED TEN YEARS AGO FOR ECONOMICAL REASONS AS THERE WERE ONLY 36 CHILDREN IN ATTENDENCE.
COACHES NOW COLLECT THE CHILDREN AND TRANSPORT THEM TO NECTON FIRST AND MIDDLE SCHOOLS, 5 TO 12 YEARS, AND HAMMONDS HIGH SCHOOL AT SWAFFHAM, 12 TO 16 YEARS. THERE IS ALSO A 6TH FORM AT HAMMONDS WHERE PUPILS CAN STAY ON TO TAKE FURTHER O AND A LEVEL EXAMINATIONS.
FURTHER EDUCATION IS AVAILABLE AT NORWICH CITY COLLEGE AND KINGS LYNN TECHNICAL COLLEGE.
A FEW CHILDREN ALSO GO TO PRIVATE SCHOOLS.
